result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiffany S. Oglesby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.   
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.  
Successfully complete Behavorial Health Treatment Court.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Rights to Appeal filed with the court.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter. Clerk: PT
Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  Defendant pleads Guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Defendant enters into Behavioral Health Treatment Court; sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld; defendant placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning and Voting Acknowledgement given.

Assistant District Attorney Zachary Wittchow, special prosecutor, appeared for the State.  Atty C Lassiter appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Case likely to be resolved in behavioral health court.  No action taken.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Lassiter states the deft is getting an ATR on another matter, is also accepted into the drug court and needs to be approved for the mental health court.  FPT continued to 6/19/14 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Rufo, for Atty C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rufo acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty plea.  Per Atty Lassiter they are looking into the drug court or mental health court.  DA PTC 5/16/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 5/27/14 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

2:10 pm    Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk:  LE.  Referred to Br. 6 for further disposition on 5-5-14 @ 8:15 am. = Argn.  Deft waives preliminary hearing.  Bound over to Br. 6.  Information filed.  Bond continued.
of right to preliminary hearing

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Def. Def. appeared (in custody) without counsel. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Atty. Carmen Lassiter was unavailable for court. Case rescheduled to 1:00pm today to reschedule preliminary hearing. Bond continued.
